meanings.definition: The quality of being unreliable or inconsistent.
meanings.sent1: Her flakinesses in keeping promises made it hard to trust her.
meanings.sent2: The flakinesses of the weather forecast led to confusion.
meanings.sent3: His flakinesses in showing up on time became a running joke among his friends.
meanings.sent4: The flakinesses of the old building's foundation caused it to collapse unexpectedly.
meanings.sent5: The flakinesses of the internet connection made it impossible to finish the online test.

meanings.definition: The tendency to break or crumble easily.
meanings.sent1: The flakinesses of the pastry made it deliciously crispy.
meanings.sent2: The flakinesses of the old book pages indicated their age.
meanings.sent3: The flakinesses of the cookie made it a delightful treat to enjoy.
meanings.sent4: The flakinesses of the dry leaves underfoot signaled the arrival of autumn.
meanings.sent5: The flakinesses of the pie crust added a wonderful texture to the dessert.

meanings.definition: The state of being easily irritated or upset.
meanings.sent1: Her flakinesses were evident when she snapped at the slightest inconvenience.
meanings.sent2: The child's flakinesses were apparent when he started crying over a small toy.
meanings.sent3: His flakinesses were comically portrayed in the play, much to the audience's amusement.
meanings.sent4: The flakinesses of the boss were like a storm brewing in the office.
meanings.sent5: The flakinesses of the cat were evident as it hissed at anyone who came near.
